examples: The children enjoyed a refreshing slice of watermelon on a hot summer day.
Parents often support their children financially during college.
The children threw the crumpled paper balls into the classroom trash can.
The children decorated their cupcakes on a colorful dish.
The children drank their juice from colorful plastic glasses.
words.defineEn: a young person who has not reached puberty or adulthood yet
words.defineVi: một người trẻ chưa đến tuổi dậy thì hoặc trưởng thành

examples: The company kicked off the CEO for embezzlement.
The company abandoned its outdated marketing strategy in favor of a more innovative approach.
Our company puts the emphasis on quality.
Many companies saw the advent of online retailing as a threat to their bricks and mortar business.
The company are playing 11 cities around the country.
words.defineEn: an organization that does business and earns money from it
words.defineVi: một tổ chức kinh doanh và kiếm tiền từ nó

examples: This clock loses two minutes a day.
Your plane leaves in ten minutes.
Programs are running a few minutes behind schedule this evening.
His first goal came in the 81st minute.
She was only five minutes late!
words.defineEn: each of the sixty parts that creates one hour and is made up of sixty seconds
words.defineVi: mỗi phần trong số sáu mươi phần tạo ra một giờ và được tạo thành từ sáu mươi giây

examples: The journey to the airport takes about half an hour.
The hour is come.
The senator held the floor for several hours.
The agreement came after several hours of negotiations.
Buses to Oxford run every half hour.
words.defineEn: each of the twenty-four time periods that exist in a day and each time period is made up of sixty minutes
words.defineVi: mỗi khoảng thời gian trong số hai mươi bốn khoảng thời gian tồn tại trong một ngày và mỗi khoảng thời gian được tạo thành từ sáu mươi phút

examples: Her second movie followed close on the heels of her successful film debut.
Her second movie followed close on the heels of her successful film debut.
Take the second road on the right.
Swimming is second nature to Jane.
She came second in the exam.
words.defineEn: each of the sixty parts that creates one minute
words.defineVi: mỗi phần trong số sáu mươi phần tạo ra một phút

examples: His carelessness lost him the job.
Jobs that pay £5 an hour.
This job puts years on you.
My job is the tough one.
The team's new manager brings ten years' experience to the job.
words.defineEn: the work that we do regularly to earn money
words.defineVi: công việc mà chúng tôi làm thường xuyên để kiếm tiền

examples: The policeman hammered home the dangers of drinking and driving.
My son is coming home soon.
The forest is home to a diverse range of plant and animal species.
I pressed the issue home to them.
To hit a home run.
words.defineEn: the place that we live in, usually with our family
words.defineVi: nơi mà chúng tôi sống, thường là với gia đình của chúng tôi

examples: Water will always find its own level.
The Geiger counter detected high levels of radiation in the vicinity of the radioactive material.
As the saying goes, new levels, new devils.
The conflict has now reached a new level of intensity.
All through the hijacking the pilot kept a level head.
words.defineEn: a point or position on a scale of quantity, quality, extent, etc.
words.defineVi: một điểm hoặc vị trí trên thang đo số lượng, chất lượng, mức độ, v.v.

examples: Give me a moment, please.
Do you have a moment?
Keeping his shirt on during intense moments.
The upcoming election is a kill or cure moment for the future of the country.
Life is not exactly a barrel of laughs at the moment.
words.defineEn: a very short period of time
words.defineVi: một khoảng thời gian rất ngắn

examples: Many more businesses are feeling the chill wind of the recession.
The business has already closed the books for this quarter.
The business is losing money.
The business has legs.
Many businesses use the Salesforce platform for customer relationship management.
words.defineEn: the activity of providing services or products in exchange for money
words.defineVi: hoạt động cung cấp dịch vụ hoặc sản phẩm để đổi lấy tiền

examples: The laws were reformed root and branch.
Boys his age are a law unto themselves.

Important new laws are already in the pipeline.
words.defineEn: a country's rules that all of its citizens are required to obey
words.defineVi: quy tắc của một quốc gia mà tất cả các công dân của nó được yêu cầu phải tuân theo

examples: A bit of good fortune came my way.
They all did their bit during the war.

Everyone should do their bit for the environment.
words.defineEn: a small amount, quantity, or piece of something
words.defineVi: một số lượng nhỏ, số lượng, hoặc mảnh của một cái gì đó

examples: Health services are lining the drug companies’ pockets, according to the report.

Remuneration is in line with comparable international organizations.
words.defineEn: a long narrow mark on a surface
words.defineVi: một dấu hẹp dài trên một bề mặt

examples: Government investment has brought thousands of new jobs to the area.

words.defineEn: a particular part or region of a city, country, or the world
words.defineVi: một phần hoặc khu vực cụ thể của một thành phố, quốc gia hoặc thế giới

examples: The group has a new CD in the pipeline.

words.defineEn: a number of things or people that have some sort of connection or are at a place together

examples: The baby cried its head off.

words.defineVi: phần trên cùng của cơ thể chúng ta, nơi đặt bộ não và khuôn mặt của chúng ta

examples: Mind your own business!

Travel broadens the mind.
My mind went totally blank.

examples: 'Thanks,' he answered.

- Thanks dudes, we'll see you tomorrow.

examples: My father has brown eyes.

words.defineVi: một bộ phận cơ thể trên khuôn mặt của chúng ta mà chúng ta có hai và sử dụng để nhìn

I pressed the issue home to them.
The winter issue is hot off the press.

examples: Schools have welcomed such arrangements with open arms.

The kids always work hard at school.

words.defineVi: một nơi mà trẻ em học những điều từ giáo viên

We lead the way in space technology.

examples: Lots of couples have problems in the first year of marriage.
